thread.title: Larimer County Sheriff will not run for Senate
thread.title_full: Larimer County Sheriff will not run for Senate

title: Larimer County Sheriff will not run for Senate
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Larimer County Sheriff will not run for Senate Larimer County Sheriff Justin Smith has decided he will not enter the 2016 campaign for United States Senate. Post to Facebook Larimer County Sheriff will not run for Senate Larimer County Sheriff Justin Smith has decided he will not enter the 2016 campaign for United States Senate.  //on9news.tv/1LSibR9   Join the Conversation To   Larimer County Sheriff will not run for Senate Mallory E Davis, KUSA 11:32 a.m. MDT October 23, 2015 Larimer County Sheriff Justin Smith. (Photo: Larimer County Sheriff's Office) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LARIMER COUNTY - Larimer County Sheriff Justin Smith has decided he will not enter the 2016 campaign for United States Senate. 
According to a Facebook post that was made Friday morning, Smith said his focus needs to be in Larimer County. 
Smith also said in the post that he feels the country is is not in a good place: "I firmly believe that our nation is in crisis. As our influence around the world has decreased, it has left a vacuum that petty dictators and extremists have been all too eager to fill. The world today is more dangerous and unstable than it has been at any point in our lifetimes. At home, our struggling economy has left too many people without hope, and a culture of lawlessness has led to brazen attacks on our law enforcement community. Those who have looked to Washington to "fix" our problems have come to realize that Washington itself is broken." 
Smith went on to thank everyone for their encouragement and support. 
If you can't see the post, click here: http://on.fb.me/1GvQCMR .
